Direct message the job poster from ModMed
Jen Idrizi CDR, CSSR
Talent Acquisition & Diversity Leader
At Modernizing Medicine, we look for passionate, innovative, creative Rock Stars!South Florida Business Journal, Business of the Year 2022BIG Awards for Business, Company of the Year 2021Best in Biz Award (Silver), Fastest-Growing Company of the Year 2021South Florida Business Journal, Best Places to Work 2021Inc. Magazine Best Workplaces of 2020Modernizing Medicine delivers truly disruptive and transformative products and services that will impact the healthcare industry. The work we do makes a difference.Our web and mobile applications are transforming healthcare information technology to increase practice efficiency and improve patient outcomes. We offer end-to-end specialty-specific solutions from practice management, through EMR to Revenue Cycle Management (RCM) that help our clients maximize their efficiencies.Modernizing Medicine is hiring a People Analytics Manager. The People Analytics Manager helps drive business results by empowering People team leaders to integrate data into daily insights and decisions as well as strategic planning. In this role, you will partner with leaders across the people team to enact and influence people strategy. You will be a trusted advisor and dedicated analytics partner to the People team. The ideal candidate will have strong leadership, analytical, and storytelling skills as well as experience scoping, managing and delivering on projects.What You'll DoLeads our journey to develop the company’s people analytics strategy and roadmap. Designs and builds dashboards/visualizations to tell a compelling and easy to understand data story across various delivery methodsApplies expertise in quantitative analysis and the presentation of data to help inform, influence, support and execute business decisions. Act as an internal consultant by understanding business needs, scoping data requests, synthesizing insights, and recommending solutions to key business partners. Drives adoption of self service analytics tools and builds organization capabilities in driving data-based decisions. Collects and compiles people metrics and data from a variety of sources including Workday, Greenhouse , surveys, exit interviews, employment records, and external benchmarks. Partners with the people team COE leaders to provide insights by analyzing data and statistics for trends and patterns with attention to recruitment, hiring practices,diversity and inclusion practices , engagement, and turnover. Partners closely with the digital experience/business team on reporting needs and requirements. Fosters relationships and builds trust with key stakeholdersMaintains knowledge of current industry trends and promotes idea sharing and standard methodologies.Experience And EducationBachelor's degree in Business or related field required.Six plus years of consulting or corporate work experience successfully using data and analytics to improve business results.Experience with predictive analytics a plusExperience in the tech industry, high-growth SAAS company preferred. Experience working with People/organizational data (e.g. headcount, turnover, recruiting metrics, diversity metrics, etc)Experience using HR systems and tools such as Workday, Domo, Tableau, Visier etc. Project management experience.Skills, Competencies And AttributesBroad knowledge in data analytics, basic statistics, and interpreting results from a people perspective. Strong data visualization and storytelling skillsRobust analytics capabilities and problem-solving skills.Ability to work effectively in a fast-paced environment Able to solve complex problems and take a critical perspective on existing solutionsTeam player with strong collaboration and stakeholder management skills. Self-directed and comfortable working in ambiguous environmentsSuperb communication skills, solid attention to detail and organizational skillsModernizing Medicine Benefit HighlightsHealth Insurance, 401(k), Vacation, Employee Assistance Program, Flexible Spending AccountsEmployee Resource Groups Professional development opportunities including tuition reimbursement programs and unlimited access to LinkedIn LearningWeekly catered breakfast and lunch, treadmill workstations, quarterly onsite massages, onsite dry cleaning, onsite car wash and many more!
